intro: Holubogentia pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean holubogentia, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the Pyrenees mountain range. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and calcareous soils, thriving in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often emitting a subtle scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
